result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment  if not paid.
*Pay supervision fees.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*NO contact with the victim.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander M Brooks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17  witness fees for witness Beverly E. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26212617 in court 1x on 8/12/15.

Defendant Alexander M Brooks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Alexander M Brooks in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
As to count 1 as amended:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for -0- days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 year with the following conditions:
- Defendant to not have contact with the victim.
-  Defendant to obtain his GED.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Witness fee request prepared for Beverly E.  will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Alexander M Brooks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Alexander M Brooks in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Parties are in court for a final pretrial date.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
Plea hearing continued...
Pursuant to negotiations, the court ordered the "repeater" enhancer dismissed.
As to charge as amended;
  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  PSI was/not ordered. \
Jury trial date of 08/12/2015 vacated.
Case set for sentencing in Branch 36.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Alexander M Brooks not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexander M Brooks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Molly Schmidt for Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for an adjourned Pretrial COnference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.C. and P.F.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Alexander M Brooks in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Alexander M Brooks in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
